meanings.definition: A person or thing that roars loudly.
meanings.sent1: The lion in the zoo was a powerful roarer.
meanings.sent2: The thunderstorm outside sounded like a roarer.
meanings.sent3: The little kitten tried to imitate the roarer lion's roar.
meanings.sent4: The engine of the old car was a constant roarer.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall in the forest was the loudest roarer of all.

meanings.definition: A person who shouts or speaks loudly and aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The coach on the field was known as a strict roarer.
meanings.sent2: The angry protester was a fierce roarer during the rally.
meanings.sent3: The roarer at the town meeting scared everyone with his loud voice.
meanings.sent4: The roarer in the argument made sure his voice was heard above all.
meanings.sent5: The roarer in the courtroom demanded justice with a booming voice.

meanings.definition: A strong wind or storm that makes a roaring sound.
meanings.sent1: The hurricane approaching was a dangerous roarer.
meanings.sent2: The roarer outside rattled the windows of the house.
meanings.sent3: The roarer wind blew away the hat of the unsuspecting man.
meanings.sent4: The roarer storm howled through the night, keeping everyone awake.
meanings.sent5: The roarer wind carried the scent of the sea far inland.
